alert.note: Alert for Burke; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern McDuffie, northwestern Burke, Richmond, north central Barnwell, central Aiken and west central Orangeburg Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Aiken State Park to near Fort Gordon. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Aiken Mall, Clearwater, Hephzibah, Williston, New Ellenton, Jackson, South Augusta, Citizens Park, Augusta Regional Airport, Aiken State Park, Gloverville, Burnettown, Wagener, Blythe, Springfield, Salley, Neeses and Keysville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 5 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina near mile marker 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
